method_binding.note: All 26 methods extracted from D3_Q4_Executor in executors.py

question_context.question_text: ¿Existe una relación factible entre la actividad (ej. 'un taller vocacional') y la meta del producto asociado (ej. '500 jóvenes con proyecto de vida estructurado') para el área de niñez y juventud? Se debe evaluar si los 'plazos' son realistas.

patterns.pattern: capacidad operativa de los orientadores escolares para
plazo para la implementación de los centros de escucha
la meta de cobertura del PAE es ambiciosa pero alcanzable
con los recursos asignados se puede lograr

signal_requirements.note: Signal requirements are currently under development. Signal IDs will be populated once the signal_registry provides a canonical mapping for PA01/DIM01.

elements.description: Lista de elementos de evidencia encontrados para esta micro-pregunta.

confidence_scores.description: Scores de confianza usados por el scorer.

pattern_matches.description: Matches de patrones esperados vs texto.

assembly_rules.description: Combine all evidence elements from 17 method invocations
Aggregate confidence scores across all methods
Combine pattern matches from text mining methods
Combine metadata from all 17 methods for full traceability

question_global.description: Índice global de la pregunta (de questionnaire_monolith).

policy_area_id.description: PA canónica, debe ser coherente con identity.policy_area_id.

cluster_id.description: Cluster de análisis según el monolith, si aplica.

evidence.description: Objeto de evidencia ensamblado por el EvidenceAssembler; debe cumplir evidence_assembly.output_schema.

validation.description: Resultado de validaciones lógicas de la respuesta (coherencia, integridad, etc.).

trace.description: Información de trazabilidad (provenance, logs) específica de la ejecución.

metadata.description: Metadatos adicionales de la pregunta para consumo posterior.

template.title: ## Análisis D1-Q1: Línea Base Cuantitativa en Derechos de las Mujeres
template.score_section:
### Evaluación Cuantitativa

- **Puntaje bruto**: {score}/3.0
- **Nivel de calidad**: {quality_level}
- **Confianza promedio**: {evidence.confidence_scores.mean}%
- **Cobertura de patrones**: {evidence.pattern_matches_count}/14 patrones detectados

method_combination_logic.combination_strategy: Sequential multi-method pipeline with evidence fusion
method_combination_logic.rationale: D1-Q1 requires comprehensive extraction of quantitative baseline data from multiple sources (text, tables, causal links). The 17 methods cover complementary aspects: text mining (methods 1-5), goal extraction (6-7), financial analysis (8-10), contradiction detection (11-13), Bayesian inference (14-15), and semantic processing (16-17).
method_combination_logic.evidence_fusion: Evidence from all 17 methods is aggregated by the EvidenceAssembler. Overlapping evidence (e.g., same numeric value detected by multiple methods) is deduplicated. Confidence scores are combined via weighted averaging.
method_combination_logic.confidence_aggregation: Final confidence per evidence element = weighted_mean([confidence_method1, confidence_method2, ...]) where weights reflect method reliability (e.g., Bayesian methods have higher weight than simple regex).
method_combination_logic.execution_order: Methods execute in priority order (1→17). Later methods can access outputs of earlier methods (e.g., method 7 uses goals extracted by method 6).
trade_offs: Comprehensiveness vs. Complexity: 17 methods ensure thorough coverage but increase computational cost and maintenance burden
Precision vs. Recall: Multiple methods increase recall (find more evidence) but may introduce redundancy; deduplication and confidence weighting mitigate this
Interpretability vs. Sophistication: Bayesian and embedding methods are powerful but less transparent than regex; human_readable_output compensates via methodological documentation

rules.description: Derived from monolith expected_elements where required is true
Derived from monolith expected_elements with minimum counts

traceability.provenance_note: This contract was generated with full multi-method orchestration support. The method_binding.methods array contains all 17 methods from D1_Q1_QuantitativeBaselineExtractor, and human_answer_structure documents the expected evidence output after execution.

fallback_strategy.note: No fallback strategies enabled. All failures propagate according to error_handling configuration.

calibration.note: Contract does not embed calibration scores. Actual calibration managed via src/saaaaaa/core/calibration/ + config/intrinsic_calibration.json + config/fusion_specification.json

human_answer_structure.description: Expected structure of evidence dict after all 17 methods execute and evidence is assembled according to assembly_rules

assembly_flow.step_1_method_execution: 17 methods execute in priority order, outputs stored with dot-notation keys
assembly_flow.step_2_evidence_assembly: EvidenceAssembler merges outputs according to assembly_rules
assembly_flow.step_4_output_generation: Phase2QuestionResult constructed with evidence, validation, trace

evidence_structure_schema.description: Assembled evidence after all methods complete

elements_found.description: Concatenated evidence elements from multiple methods (assembly_rules target)
elements_found.example_count: Expected 15-50 elements for a complete diagnostic

pattern_matches.description: Aggregated pattern matches from text mining methods

financial_summary.description: Aggregated financial data from FinancialAuditor and PDETMunicipalPlanAnalyzer

elements_found.source_sentence: según datos de DANE para el año 2022

contradictions.interpretation: No statistical contradictions in quantitative claims

validation_against_expected_elements.overall_validation_result: PASS - All required and minimum elements present

template_variable_bindings.description: These variables are available for human_readable_output template

variables.{score}: Calculated by scorer based on elements

usage_notes.for_developers: This structure shows the expected evidence dict after BaseExecutorWithContract._execute_v3() completes all 17 method executions and evidence assembly.
usage_notes.for_validators: Use this to verify that actual execution output matches expected structure.
usage_notes.for_auditors: This provides traceability from raw method outputs to final assembled evidence.
